I find it upsetting that they're trying to move more and more features to Jetpack, statistics of your blog as one thing. It eliminates the idea of needing this app altogether, because why should I install an app that requires another app in order to reach all the other functions. If I could use PayPal for a lot of the features used by WordPress (donation buttons etc, a feature that they have too for *some* things), such as to receive donations, it would be easier. Not worth it

Ok, but features on web version missing from app, that shouldn't be. (Both Wordpress and Jetpack.) Portfolio, for example. It is a special type of post, but still a post. And so it should be able to be used in-app, but isn't present. (Even when portfolio is enabled on the web version.) Makes it a real pain when a site is primarily made of portfolio post/pages.

All in all a perfect app for just typing up your blog posts, and sending them out to the world; like little love letters to existence. I do miss having it be an all in one deal, where you could read new blogs, and follow them, too. But it's not a dealbreaker that you need to use a different app for it. Just a little separation of work and leisure is all.
